content: It is difficult to say which system would be more beneficial for your world without knowing more about the specific details of your society and the values that you wish to promote. A monetary-based system may provide more flexibility and allow for greater exchange of goods and services, but it can also lead to inequality if certain individuals or groups have access to more wealth than others. A resource-allocation based system, on the other hand, could help to promote equality by ensuring that everyone has access to the resources they need to meet their basic needs. However, it may be more difficult to implement and could potentially stifle innovation and economic growth. Ultimately, the best system for your world will depend on the specific goals and values that you wish to promote.
